edu.northwestern.jcr.adapter.xtf.util
Class ApplyXPath

java.lang.Object
  edu.northwestern.jcr.adapter.xtf.util.ApplyXPath

public class ApplyXPath
extends java.lang.Object

Very basic utility for applying an XPath epxression to an xml file and printing information about the execution of the XPath object and the nodes it finds. Takes 2 arguments: (1) an xml filename (2) an XPath expression to apply to the file Examples: java ApplyXPath foo.xml / java ApplyXPath foo.xml /doc/name[1]/@last

Author:
Xin Xiang

evaluateFile

public java.lang.String[] evaluateFile(java.lang.String filename,
                                       java.lang.String xpath)
                                throws java.lang.Exception
Process input args and execute the XPath and return an array of string. The xpath needs to point to a text node.

Parameters:
filename - name of the XML file
xpath - the XPath expression
Returns:
the nodes as a result of the evaluation
Throws:
java.lang.Exception
